genresAdvancedInfo.name: polish post-rock
genresAdvancedInfo.description: Polish post-rock is a genre of experimental rock music that emerged in Poland in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of atmospheric textures, extended instrumental passages, and unconventional song structures. Polish post-rock bands often draw influences from genres such as ambient, shoegaze, and classical music, and their music is often described as cinematic and emotionally evocative.
